oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of a girl dressed as a newspaper vendor, the vice president and his secretary, a tower in the Bahamas, and three ads. Nashville Banner, 1929 March 24.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Parrish, Polly; Williams, Lola M.; Curtis, Charles; Wilkes, Richard Amis, III
Nashville Banner
Newspaper vendors; Vice presidents; Office workers; Towers; Children
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of a girl dressed as a Banner newspaper vendor for an advertising-themed Vanderbilt fraternity party, vice president Curtis and his secretary, a tower at Nassau, Bahamas, and three ads, one of which features a local child who resides at 1215 McChesney Avenue. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Meyer & Holt; P. & A. Photo
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
